page.title: 20THE FIRE STATION CLUB
page.content: The Oxfordshire Fire Service is in two divisions A & B. Didcot is in B Division, whose Headquarters are in Kidlington. Didcot is not one of the 3 fully-manned Fire Stations. It is a 3-day manned one. There are three fire engines, including one for training. Over the years, firemens' work is more complicated eg. a child may have something stuck on his or her finger, a head between bars, a foot behind a radiator or someone may be locked out. The actual firemen are entitled members of the Fire Station Club, but other men and women pay 50p to obtain embership. Members are allowed to take their children. In 1983, when he Fire Station moved to its present site on Broadway, it won the Â£Best Dressed Building' award - the Coronation cup.
